cms_page.title: About us
cms_page.content:
Gloo.ng is an electronic retailing service and corporate procurement engine dedicated to delivering direct to the doorsteps of her clients, on a same-day basis and at very affordable prices, a wide variety of high quality brands of supermarket goods. Gloo.ng provides her clients very convenient, very efficient and very affordable means of shopping for supermarket goods, saving them irreplaceable time, needless stress and valuable money, thereby enriching their lives with the happiness these savings facilitate. Gloo.ng is more than an online ecommerce site. It is a vision!

  • OUR VISION

    Be The Biggest Nigerian Supermarket

  • OUR MISSION

    Promote the comfort & happiness of busy homemakers

  • OUR PURPOSE

    Redefine & own the word "supermarket" in Nigeria

OUR MOTTO

Heads down; ignore the noise. Stay hungry; stay focused. Keep shipping!

OUR VALUES

(aka, The Glootian Creed)

There is nothing ordinary about us. EVERYTHING is done to the extreme. We are extremists!

1.) Extreme Customer-Focus: this is where it ALL starts & ends, where it rises & falls, where it waxes & wanes.

2.) Extreme Team Players: the COEFFICIENT force of the tightly knit phalanx of 300 Spartan Hoplites at Thermopylae.

3.) Extreme Integrity: always aiming for singularity in what we say and what we do, by over-delivering on the DOING than the saying. It's a discipline you master, a way of life...OUR way of life.

4.) Extreme Frugality: creatively pulling needles out of hay sacks is FIRST nature, not second nature.

5.) Extreme Learners: failing fast, failing small and improving CONTINUALLY--an endless loop of discovery and joy. 

6.) Extreme (M)(Ad)Venturers: junkies of the thrill of walking on water, of DEFYING gravity. It's where we thrive, our sweet spot!

OUR BEATITUDES

  1. We enjoy working hard.
  2. We speak with candour.
  3. We love meeting but hate meetings.
  4. We are passionate about sticking to time.
  5. We cultivate a friendly but intense environment.
  6. We prefer the simple and are always simplifying.
  7. We embrace bad news and celebrate good news.
  8. We are paranoid but don't speak fear: we speak faith.
  9. We are in a hurry but make allowance for patience's perfect work.

cms_page.title: Global Customer Service
cms_page.content:
Venustheme Delivery and Returns

We hope you love shopping with Venustheme. Here are our delivery and returns policies to help make sure we meet your expectations. Contact Us.

Shipping and Delivery

Shipping and Delivery is the charge for internet order processing, item selection, packaging, transport and handling. We don’t guarantee delivery times, but we do our best to provide accurate estimates.

Deliveries occur only on weekdays. Shipping and Delivery charges are subject to change and are determined when you order. Estimated delivery time assumes orders are placed before 12:00 noon (PST). Orders you place with Venustheme late on Friday or on Saturday will not be processed until Monday. Charges may be added to orders with Priority, Overnight and International shipping if we try unsuccessfully to deliver your order more than once.

Delivery addresses in Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, and Guam should add an additional $5.00 charge for standard Shipping & Delivery. Orders arrive in 7 to 9 business days when ordered before 12:00 noon (PST).

Shipping and Delivery
Merchandise total *STANDARD
5—7 day shipping **		PRIORITY
2—3 day shipping **		OVERNIGHT
Next business day **
Up to $200 $16 $26 $33
$200.01—500.00 $21 $31 $38
$500.01—1000.00 $29 $39 $46
Over $1000.00 $34 $44 $51

*before tax and additional charges
**after processing if ordered by 12:00 noon PST

Returns and Replacements

We want you to be completely happy with your Venustheme order. If for any reason you are not satisfied, we will gladly accept your timely return of unworn, unwashed, or defective merchandise. Used merchandise cannot be returned unless defective. Returned merchandise should include the vendor packaging and tags and be in the same condition as when it was received. A pickup and/or restock fee may apply. Merchandise must be returned within 30 days of receipt of merchandise.

Returning Gifts

When returning a gift, a Venustheme Gift Card will be issued to the gift recipient for the amount of the returned merchandise. The card can be used for purchases from any Venustheme store, and online. In compliance with Federal law, for gifts valued at more than $2,000.00, the recipient will receive a check rather than an Venustheme Gift Card.

Returning Merchandise by Mail

On the back of the packing slip enclosed with your Venustheme order, please note the reason(s) for return and whether you wish to exchange the item(s) or receive a credit/refund (depending on the original form of payment).

Enclose the return section of the packing slip with your item(s). Please use one of the return labels provided on the front of your packing slip to ensure proper return address and credit information. Restricted items must be returned using ground transportation.

Please allow 10 to 14 days for Venustheme to process your return.

cms_page.title: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
cms_page.content:
How do I register for the Gloo.ng service?

You will be registered for the service during your first purchase. (You can also create an account now, ahead of placing an order in future.)

How do I place an order for items on the Gloo.ng online store?

Simply browse the website and add the respective quantities of the items you want to buy to your shopping cart by clicking on the "Add To Cart" button displayed against each product available in stock. Once you are done shopping, click "Checkout" at the right upper corner of the website to place your order.

What time of the day can I place orders?

ANYTIME of the day. Yes, 24 hours of every day of the week.

When and how do i receive my orders?

Orders placed and confirmed before 12noon (for Lagos Island locations) or 9am (for Lagos Mainland locations) on a particular day shall be delivered to your doorstep between 12noon and 7pm of that same day--excluding Sundays. The specific 3-hour window for your delivery will be communicated once delivery routings have been concluded for that particular day. (Orders placed after the cut-off times for Same-Day delivery will be delivered along with next day's deliveries.)

How do I pay for my purchase?

1. Internet Banking Direct Transfer: simply do a transfer to our GTBank account, quoting the Order ID of your purchase.

2. Cash on Delivery (CoD): cash is collected at the point of delivery.

3. Point of Sale (POS) Terminal: a debit card is used to make payment at the point of delivery.

4. Bank Card: Debit MasterCard, Verve, Visa & InterSwitch cards accepted: click on the Quickteller link sent with your Order Confirmation email to make payment.

5. ATM: simply do an account-to-account transfer to our GTBank account from any ATM using the Quickteller service.

(A minimum order of N4,000 is required before checkout. All orders below N15,000 attract a N399 convenience fee.)

Which locations do you currently serve?

We presently serve the whole of Lagos State--except Badagry and Epe.

I could not find any phone number to reach you on the website?

You won't find any: that is not an accident. Phone support/contact is strictly reserved for registered users who are making or have made purchases. Please use the "Contact Us" email footlink below for all your enquiries.

I still have more questions?

Please send an email to support@gloo.ng

cms_page.title: Careers
cms_page.content:
Looking for a job? You most definitely won't find that at Venustheme.com . But you will find a career--and a calling!

A career at Gloo.ng offers you a chance to make a difference in your life and the lives of people in your nation, Nigeria. We help our associates realize their dreams by creating opportunities for them to discover and fulfill their personal and professional vision within the context of our corporate vision. Our people have made laser-beam focus on customer satisfaction their calling in life. What is yours? Come and discover it--or fulfill it--with us! Our True North is to do to supermarket shopping in Nigeria what Amazon did to book shopping in the US.

If you are interested in becoming a part of our Venustheme Team and in running with The Vision, please send your resume as a  .pdf  file attachment to careers@venustheme.com, quoting the vacancy you are applying for as the subject title of the email. 

CUSTOMER FULFILMENT (0)

 

FINANCE, ADMIN & HR (0)

 

TECHNOLOGY (1)

  • Software Engineer/Intern (PHP/Quality Assurance).

Responsibilities:

  1. Work with the team to develop functional tests for  web applications
  2. Work with the team to execute and modify existing test cases/suites
  3. Work with the team to build/extend Magento modules
  4. Work with the team to provide technical support for the application.

Qualifications:

  1. Native alignment with our Glootian Culture, Values & Beatitudes: http://www.venustheme.com/who_we_are.
  2. OND or Equivalent Degree
  3. Working Knowledge of PHP
  4. Knowledge of HTML
  5. JavaScript
  6. Object Oriented Programming
  7. Knowledge of Software Testing
  8. Worked with any PHP MVC Framework
  9. Portfolio of work done (including school or personal projects)
  10. Interaction with Magento or any other ecommerce framework

MARKETING (1)

 

SOURCING (0)

cms_page.title: Founding Team
cms_page.content:
OLUMIDE OLUSANYA (D.O)

D.O is our Founder & CEO View Olumide Olusanya, Dr's LinkedIn profile

He has overseen the building and development of the local and international payment networks of majority of Nigeria’s Tier-1 banks and, in Q4-2003, led the team that developed the POS system that processed Nigeria's first online-realtime POS transaction. He also led the team that rolled out West Africa's first indigenously issued and processed online-realtime international payment card, Ecobank MasterCard, in Q4-2004. Olumide played a pivotal and strategic role at Cards Technology Limited (brought in as technology co-founder, then CEO), building and establishing it from its technology implementation phase leading up to its operational phase. He sat on a number of Central Bank of Nigeria’s Payment Systems Committees, including the Committee that conceptualized the National Central Switch (NCS). He turned around United Bank for Africa (UBA)’s Payment Card Business within 16 months of running it.

He garnered his experience in Oracle Database Support, Applications Implementation and UNIX System Administration at two Tier-1 Oracle Certified Solutions Partner firms. He had his MBA at the Lagos Business School (LBS) and is an alumni of Oxford University's Business School.

DAVID UMOH

David is our Head of Software Engineering

Prior to Gloo, David worked for 4 years as Team Lead, PHP with SocketWorks Ltd where he led the development of several key applications including a pin generation, verification & payment aggregation platforms for banks. His team implemented the Nigerian Immigration Service (NIS) Data Capture, Processing & Management systems. Other projects worked on include a crowd-funding platform, a market-place ecommerce platform, CGPA and Transcripts calculation modules. As Team Lead, he was also responsible for setting-up proper version control policies and a quality assurance framework for the development team.

Before joining SocketWorks, he worked as a developer with INITS Ltd where he worked on several web applications and was part of the team that carried out Linux training for the INEC support staff across the nation. His skills include full stack LAMP(Linux, Apache, Mysql, PHP) development, Java, Python, Javascript and HTML 5; Software architecture, configuration management and Agile Software Project management.

He received a B.Eng in Electrical/Electronics Engineering from University of Port Harcourt, Nigeria.

OLUWASEYIN OLUSANYA

Seyin is our Head of Sourcing Operations.

Prior to joining Gloo, Seyin worked at Alok Consulting an SAP Partner Firm in Nigeria as the SAP Lead for the Sales and Distribution Implementation on the PPMC Project and also as the in-house SAP HCM Solution Trainer. She successfully achieved a 90% pass rate of trainees who sat for the SAP HCM Consultant Certification Exam.

Before joining Alok Consulting, Seyin was part of various SAP implementations at Hartford Green Consulting were she held several positions as team member, quality assurance analyst and project manager. She left Hartford Green Consulting as Head of SAP Department. Her previous experiences also include Sales, Customer Service and Business Software Management at StarComms PLC in Nigeria.

Seyin received a B.Sc in Psychology from the University of Lagos, Nigeria.

MALIK BABLOLA

Malik is our Head of Fulfilment Operations

Malik joined Gloo.ng as a fresh graduate after obtaining a B.Sc(Hons) from the University of Ibadan. He distinguished himself among his colleagues to become the Head of Fulfillment Operations. He leads the last mile delivery operations and customer fulfillment service teams, giving him oversight of the largest team at Gloo.ng. He has attended a handful of Customer Service and Operations trainings. He is a true embodiment of what it means to be a Glootian.

cms_page.title: Value Proposition
cms_page.content:
We ARE NOT IN THE BUSINESS OF SELLING groceries

Balancing a busy work schedule with nurturing a happy home and family in the busy cities of Nigeria is extremely challenging, tasking and energy-draining. Gloo.ng saves busy homemakers the pain and needless hassles related to supermarket shopping, enabling them focus their time and energy on rewarding activities, such as those that promote their personal well being, business or career, family and happiness. We are in the business of promoting the comfort and happiness of busy homemakers and their families. We are in the happiness business.

cms_page.title: Venustheme Sellers' Program
cms_page.content:
Dear Potential Gloo.ng Merchant, Seller or Supplier,

Thanks for your interest in wanting to sell your products on our platform. We presently have two models for onboarding new supply sources. Kindly please send the following to contact@venustheme.com with subject heading "Gloo.ng Merchants and Sellers Program" for the review of our Sourcing Team, who will then determine which of two models best fits your requirement.

1.) your company profile with full contact information of the primary liaison person.

2.) pdf or word document having the names, descriptions and pictures of your products.

3.) excel sheet with products list and all pricing information, including especially the RSPs.

4.) known-brand brick-and-mortar supermarkets and online stores where these products are currently being sold.

Once we are in receipt of the above, our Sourcing Team will review your submission to determine which of the two models best fits your requirements and the category of products you wish to sell. Subsequently, a member of our Sourcing Team will reach out to you with a view to taking the intended relationship forward. Kindly provide 3-5 working days for such.

We are thankful for the honour and trust you are according us to help make this relationship a win-win for our users, for you as well as for ourselves. We look forward to receiving your submission.

 

Thank you.

 

Yours Sincerely,

The Venustheme
